values.name: <extension-name>
values.prose: All extensions defined in this specification use a common syntax for defining their ”names”: the <extension-name> production. An <extension-name> is any identifier that starts with two dashes (U+002D HYPHEN-MINUS), like --foo, or even exotic names like -- or ------. The CSS language will never use identifiers of this form for any language-defined purpose, so it’s safe to use them for author-defined purposes without ever having to worry about colliding with CSS-defined names.
